I'm sorry to hear that but.. It is the truth. It is quite harsh to hear as a child. I wasn't really raised as 'religiously' as you, sure we had prayers when I visited my grandparents back in my home country but we rarely ever prayed. Church on Sundays only. My mom also listens to a lot of Christian music that I don't really listen to. It was more so other influences like preaching of the Gospel via social media that changed me. 

I may still not be the best person but with the help of Christ, I've been able to improve myself to be an overall better person. I no longer worry about exams and such because, either I can win them if I work for it and if I don't, I won't fear because the Lord has plans for me and will watch out for me. I'm sorry to hear that you may have had a bad childhood relating to Christ but please do not hate him for the actions of people! He does love you and he doesn't want for you to get hurt

Nah here in India we're not allowed to bring phones into school property at all. We use the school office Telephones to call. Sometimes they get confiscated till the end of the day and sometimes you have to tell your parents to come and ask the principal to give back your phone. 

I can't say this is the same for all schools in all parts of India but in my school, at least. Here smuggling phones in during school is like smuggling in drugs, which from the way I hear happen more than the former.
